attributes.action: Make single carriageway A-roads safer
attributes.background: Single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. With a record £6m investment in our road network, the Government should legislate for physical barriers on single carriageway A-roads to prevent head on collisions, and for a reduction in the speed limit.
attributes.additional_details: Research by the Road Safety Foundation concluded that single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. Having been involved in a high speed head on collision on a single carriageway A-road, a physical barrier in the middle of the road would prevent unscrupulous drivers from overtaking, thus eradicating the possibility of a head on collision. Moreover, a reduction in the speed limit from 60mph would also further improve road safety.

attributes.action: Reduce income tax for people who are earning under £43,000 from 20% to 15%.
attributes.background: People all over the United Kingdom work very hard for their money that they earn, and are being taxed way too much. If 5% was reduced from the general tax rate, employees would be much happier with their jobs. Unemployed people will be more likely to work as the salary rates will be more appealing.

attributes.action: Look into the spiralling costs of funerals.
attributes.background:
A certainty that we will all be faced with... only until it happens to a loved one how many of you have thought about the costs associated with a funeral? A basic funeral at today's price is roughly £3000 projected to rise up to £6000 by 2023*

*figures taken from one funeral director.
attributes.additional_details:
The above cost is bad enough but doesn't stop there as it doesn't include the following to name a few: Embalming, burial plot, memorial or headstone, flowers, catering/wake.

I recently lost my sister at the age of 32, taken early & wouldn't have put anything in place to cover the costs.  As a result at what is a very difficult time for all involved we had to cover the costs.

A stress that isn't needed at a time when grieving & an issue that people then want to put behind them.

attributes.action: Stop the formal testing of children at primary school in the UK.
attributes.background: Stop the UK Government from forcing primary schools to subject our young children to regular formal testing. It is no longer just SAT's in year 2 and 6. Children are now forced three times per academic year to go through week long tests carried out like formal exams with exam papers and time limits.
attributes.additional_details: There is no evidence that subjecting young children to these formal test situations improves academic achievement. There is however a lots of evidence that mental health issues, depression, stress and anxiety are increasing in our children and young people. There is also much evidence around the importance of play and physical exercise especially for primary age children. So why is the UK Government forcing schools to subject our children to these formal exam situations? Help protect childhood.

attributes.action: To have all school zones become 20mph for the safety of children.
attributes.background: We expect all of our children to go to school safely often schools are on busy main roads or down country lanes.  Visibility of the children can be poor and parents having to go on to work, parking can also cause a temporary hazard.  We fairly request roads have their speed limits lowered to 20mph.
attributes.additional_details:
The Road Safety Analysis (RSA) body found that there were 85,814 road incidents within a 500 mtr radius of a school equating to more than a 1,000 per month.  In 2014 the Department of Transport confirmed road deaths or serious had risen in each quarter compared to 2013.  In this period the DfT confirmed incidents increased by 6%.

These are frightening figures and it wouldn't take much to put up a few signs telling motorists to reduce their speed to 20mph at national government cost.

attributes.action: Balance the petition system by allowing people to sign both for and against.
attributes.background:
I'm calling for the petition system to take both for and against votes while retaining the 100,000 signatures needed. 
This way overall public opinion will drive the need for a response or parliamentary debate. 
The current system does not give a voice to those people who agree with something.

attributes.action: Include MPs from all political parties in the negotiations team for Brexit
attributes.background: The negotiated results will be permanent and are too important to be subject to party politics.  Approaches to strategy and policy could be designed to make sure no one party would be able to obstruct the process. It would help to re-unite the UK and lead to a better outcome for all of us.

attributes.action: Increase funding for an EHCP to allow mainstream schools to get the correct help
attributes.background: I have been fighting for 3 years to get an EHCP for my child, he now has one but with very little funding so he is unable to get the right help at school. He is missing out on education at a very important stage of his life. This process is effecting hundreds of SEN children, it's not fair.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Theresa May as PM over withheld information on Trident
attributes.background: The Commons voted to renew the £2.9b/year Trident nuclear missile program. We, the taxpayers, respect the outcome of democracy. However, if Theresa May made clear that Trident had malfunctioned, the result of the vote may have changed. Impeach the PM for dishonesty and a disservice to the people.
attributes.additional_details:
https://youtu.be/0WlVMeIEYpk
The PM repeatedly avoided a clear question on this issue, providing no reassurance to the public or the Commons about the safety of Trident.
The Trident Comission estimates that £2.9 billion will be spent annually on Trident. If it is not in working order, it poses a massive risk to the world, as well as being a waste of taxpayers' money.

attributes.action: Debate the referendum results before the Article 50 vote
attributes.background: The margin was just over 1m of 33.5m voted/46.5m eligible; areas of high immigration voted remain; under 44 year olds voted remain (18-24: 73%, 25-34: 62; and 35-44 58%); Scotland and Northern Ireland voted remain.
attributes.additional_details: MPs need to uphold their duty to act in the interests of the nation as a whole  and claims of a 'decisive' vote are inaccurate

attributes.action: Cease backing UN resolution outlawing Israel’s presence beyond 1967 borders
attributes.background: Britain's vote to outlaw Israel's presence beyond the 1967 borders is unacceptable and it is supporting a one-sided motion. We must stop putting pressure on Israel, and allow the Israelis and Palestinians to negotiate their positions. This is key to prevent negative effects of religion on Britain.

attributes.action: To invest money in local government so they can support homeless shelters.
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students from Greenwood Academy in Birmingham studying GCSE Citizenship. For a campaign we feel in our local area that there is not enough support given to aid local government in building more homeless shelters and provide assistance to those who need it.

attributes.action: Drivers of motor vehicles to use headlights at all times of the day and night.
attributes.background: Vehicles are often driven in poor light conditions. Vehicle colourings can make them nearly invisible against background colours. In daylight they can also be difficult to see. Compulsory headlights would make vehicles more visible and improve road safety. A no cost issue to motorists. A WIN WIN.

attributes.action: give expats the vote in future referendums
attributes.background: I am petitioning to give expats from the UK the vote in any future referendum in the UK.

attributes.action: Impose minimum standards for UK phone network providers to meet.
attributes.background: Having tried several networks over the years I found that non of our providers can supply a minimum standard phone signal across Norfolk, yet we are now being told about 5G most of us bearly get signal for a call or text or 2G. Our phones are for our safety and with no signal we are not safe.

attributes.action: Ban strikes 1 week before and after the top 10 designated 'peak use' times p/a
attributes.background:
Striking should not be targeted at consumers. 

As strikes cite reasons such as 'safety' for their end purposes, there is no legitimate reason to arrange strikes around the busiest / highest consumer use times. 

This petition would stop consumer suffering whilst still protecting workers rights.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence in plentiful supply today, looking at post offices, airports, trains etc.

attributes.action: Make it 'illegal' to setup None Legal Encampment's, with the Police given Powers
attributes.background:
The Police must be given the Powers to Remove people as they Arrive, it should not be for the Councils and Land Owners to Waste money taking Action, also any Mess/Damage must be got from the ones who caused it like breaking in, and Human Waste.
At this time it is Unfair that Council Money is Waste
attributes.additional_details:
Some in the Traveling sector cause issues with Locals, Fly Tip, our council plus the City council have had to pay out good money in Repairs with one area which a school uses closed for eight days cleaning up their mess and repairs to the grass area, another they lifted out posts to a play area, cut chains on gates Only to be moved on to do the same again, No Law in this practice.

Let's make the Laws apply to All.

attributes.action: National insurance should pay for old peoples care, not council tax
attributes.background:
Council tax is a blunt tool, not related to income, and therefore ability to pay.
Many councils are in financial trouble, because of the squeeze from government, and inflationary pressures.
Government can redistribute cash to the areas that need it. leaving the councils to deal with local issues

attributes.action: Solve the gridlock occuring on the M5 between Almondsbury & Clevedon.
attributes.background: Due to the design of the Avonmouth Bridge, the 3 mile long queues to leave the M5 at junction 19 (Portishead) both morning and evening, repeated accidents between junctions 18 and 19, in part due to road design, inpart due to careless driving, life on the M5 is now intolerable.
attributes.additional_details: One needs only reference Inrix, view CCTV or stand on a bridge to see the chaos and misery caused to locals, commuter, holiday makers and businesses. Now is the time to design a 2nd Avonmouth crossing, take local traffic for Portishead off at junction 18 (or use a design similar to J5-6, M20), bulldoze Gordano services, redesign junction 19, put in SMART motorway, widen the carriageways and if necessary re-route the motorway for long distance traffic from junction 15 to a new junction 19A.

attributes.action: Open places for homeless and people alone to socialise
attributes.background: With Christmas day coming up many people will be spending it alone and walking into new year alone, this petition is to try and get the government to agree to try and fund places for people like this. As people of the community to volunteer to help give the homeless and others to not feel alone.
attributes.additional_details: This may not be an issue for the government to agree on but it could be possible for them to consider funding socialise centres! Yes we have many places for these people like "feed the homeless" but what about the people sat alone on Christmas Day with nobody, reminding themselves they are alone! By signing this it will show the government their funding would be useful and many people in the community would love the opportunity to volunteer. Thankyou for reading please sign! See what we can do.

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of media bias in secondary education
attributes.background: Everyday we are fed information from the media, be it TV, newspapers, news sites, billboards, etc. The media needs money, and so they will do what they need to do to be financially viable, going as far as inciting hate. Compulsory teaching of media bias may help people make more informed choices.

attributes.action: Introduce the drinking age of 21
attributes.background:
Alcohol has many side affects. It's scientifically proved that it can damage the devolving brain cells of the teenagers.
However the majority of 21 year old are fully developed, therefore the effects of alcohol upon the brain is significantly lower.

attributes.action: Do not cut NHS unsociable hours pay.
attributes.background:
There is talk about fresh contracts to be implemented for the rest of the NHS staff. Due to the national shortage of healthcare professionals and workers, it would not be feasible to cut pay further. 
A lot of NHS staff rely on unsociable hours pay, to feed their families and so forth.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS needs a revamp and a boost, but not at the expense of front-line staff. It is not ideal to venture down this path and it would be an idea to explore other options, as opposed to cutting people's pay. The NHS also needs to encourage future employees and this is a solution, to a recruitment problem.

attributes.action: make abortion illegal in the uk unless raped or health risks to mum or baby
attributes.background: make abortion illegal in the united kingdom unless pregnant by rape or there is health risks to the mum and/or baby

attributes.action: Allow existing annuities to be transferred into another existing private pension
attributes.background: Government has cancelled previous intention to allow annuities to be sold.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for food outlets to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background:
In the uk it is not a legal requirement for food outlets to display their food hygiene ratings. 
 

Many people don't know that you can check online, many people assume the government wouldn't allow somewhere to be open if they received 0-1-2 stars. 

But they are aloud to stay open.
attributes.additional_details:
Check out local places in your area. 
http://ratings.food.gov.uk

My local chicken shop received a 0..
Local Costcutter received a 1
Local Cafe received a 1
All are still open.

Major improvements required
System or checks in place to ensure that food sold or served is safe to eat, the food safety officer has confidence that standards will be maintained in future.

Cleanliness and condition of facilities and building to enable good food hygiene.

http://www.youtube.com/user/FoodStandardsAgency

attributes.action: Stop educational institutes in the UK from sending farm animals off to slaughter
attributes.background: It has come to our attention that some educational institutes in the UK such as colleges that teach Land-based courses are raising farm animals to be slaughtered for meat. Enough animals in the UK are being farmed for meat and the practice is simply unnecessary. What do the students gain from this?
attributes.additional_details: Some students at the colleges who carry out this practice have been affected and none of the students were aware of the practice before signing up for Land-based courses. A parent of a student who suffered the same trauma of raising animals destined for the slaughterhouse quoted: “We don’t agree that this is how animals should be treated - especially at a learning facility." There are also many viable alternatives for the animals raised such as being released to a sanctuary.

attributes.action: Make employers test for cannabis using the saliva test rather than urine.
attributes.background: The urine test for cannabis is thought to be able to detect cannabis taken from upto 2-3 months prior to the test. This is a massive issue as cannabis has no impairment on your work even a day later. The saliva test used by police for roadside testing only detects cannabis taken that day.
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis is used worldwide as medication and although it could affect the way in which you work, the effects wear off after a few hours.

The test for alcohol in a work place can only detect alcohol taken that day or the day before therefore, the same should apply to cannabis.

Unemployment is already a massive issue in the UK and these tests only make it more difficult for people to maintain their employment wether they use recreationally or for medical purposes.

attributes.action: Ban all forms of Cold Calling In All Areas Of The UK
attributes.background: We the people of the United Kingdom would like to petition the UK Government to place a ban on all forms of cold calling in all areas of the UK (England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland).
attributes.additional_details:
People across the UK regularly receive cold calls through a number of methods... door to door, telephone etc from sales, PPi and many more. It is believed that a lot of people find this to be anti social and crime related to cold calling would appear to be on the rise, especially with the elderly, people with mental health issues and people at risk.

Door to door cold calling can be unsettling & telephone cold calling can be a nuisance as opt out services such as TPS don't seem to work.

attributes.action: Increase the horsepower of motorcycles to 90bhp for an A2 License holder.
attributes.background: Objective is to increase BHP on a motorcycle for those who ride on an A2 license (19 years of age)
attributes.additional_details: Its unfair that car users, after passing their driving practical exam at 17 years of age can go a buy any car they want (assuming they can afford it , e.g  Ferrari, BMW or any higher performance vehicle) whereas a motorycles user cannot ride anything over 47bhp (A2 license) until they are 21 or 24 years of age. Those who misbehave and abuse such a privillege (if changes commence) must accept and deal with the consequences even if it results in their own injury/death

attributes.action: We demand that the government guarantees adequate future funding for the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in dire risk of future collapse, due primarily to the pressure of inadequate funding from the government. We ask this and future governments to guarantee that the NHS will continue to be a free and full health service, and to commit to funding levels set by an independent expert body.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37331350

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35653455

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/sep/10/hospitals-on-brink-of-collapse-say-health-chiefs

http://metro.co.uk/2016/09/11/nhs-is-at-tipping-point-as-hospitals-struggle-with-severe-lack-of-funds-6121127/

http://www.itv.com/news/2016-09-11/cash-strapped-hospitals-face-unpalatable-choices-over-care-levels-warns-nhs-chief/

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/25/glut-of-nhs-closures-ahead-warn-hospital-chiefs/

attributes.action: Make compulsory DNA testing in order to reduce crime a law
attributes.background: dna helps the police find criminals faster and more efficiently. in order to do this they need to take one mouth swab sample of everyone in the country. This may have negative effects on example would be privacy. But would you give a sample of your dna to keep you and your friends and family safe.

attributes.action: Make premium rate text services need physical signature on terms and charges.
attributes.background: Premium rate text services send you a text message on your mobile and when you reply/text stop, you get charged without knowing charges or terms and conditions of service. Mobile operators charge on their behalf and you can't contact these premium rate text providers.
attributes.additional_details: It's happening all too often and to vulnerable people. Make it must for premium rate text services providers to get physical signature of billpayers on charges , terms and conditions for these services.

attributes.action: People to be fined if, deemed by paramedics that the call is not an emergency.
attributes.background: People are to be fined £150, if paramedics deem the call to be a non-emergency. To help prevent time-wasting calls across Britain. This will allow for the NHS to not be under as much pressure and abuse that they are now.
attributes.additional_details: Local news has shown, nurses, paramedics and other health care staff are abused on a regular basis, in hospitals, doctors surgeries and on the road attending 999 calls. These types of people and calls should be put to a stop, to help our Emergency services.

attributes.action: Make all UK schools have mental health and anti-bullying guidance counsellors
attributes.background: It is becoming more concerning that children in the UK are not getting the correct mental health and counselling. This then leads to addictions, suicides, self-harming, eating disorders etc.
attributes.additional_details: I would like to propose on-site counselling in schools to help with the growing mental health and bullying epidemic.

attributes.action: Abolish the Lords Spiritual - let secular values prevail!
attributes.background:
The Lords Spiritual consists of 26 Bishops who sit in the House of Lords - including the infamous Justin Welby himself. All have a right to vote and they sit on the Government bench. They have too much religious influence over the United Kingdom. We should be secular!

Abolish the Lords Spiritual!

attributes.action: Make vaccinations for Meningitis B available to all babies and children!
attributes.background: After seeing another child lost to meningitis B in the news we need to address that there is a vaccination available for £155 but the government won't routinely provide it to our children. We need to change this, the government must act on this now-too many lives have been lost, let's prevent more!
attributes.additional_details: How can the government put a price on our children's lives?!

attributes.action: Cut the foreign aid budget, and use the funds to fix potholes on UK roads.
attributes.background: U.K roads have been seriously neglected by UK governments to the point of being dangerous for road users. Foreign aid should be cut to pay for urgently needed repairs. An annual online audit should be produced for public scrutiny, showing total road tax revenue, and how this money is being spent.

attributes.action: Modify the petition system to force Parliament debate of >100,000 signatures
attributes.background:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Remove "considered for"
attributes.additional_details:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Rewrite as 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be debated in Parliament."

attributes.action: Give clear statement about the post-brexit future of EU citizens
attributes.background: I'd like Theresa May to finally give a clear statement about the post-brexit future of EU citizens who've been living and working in the UK for many years. Their future is now one big question mark and people need to know what's going to happen to them. For many UK became home and only place to live
attributes.additional_details: Since the start of brexit campaign the subject of EU citizens living and working in UK has beed avoided and so far there are only questions and no answers at all. People made UK their homes, have jobs, children (who often are british citizens), bought their first houses and settled in. Now this all is one big question mark and people fear that their lives can be turned upside down within two years time.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke in the uk for everyone born after 2020 Save our kids.
attributes.background:
Cigarette smoking harms nearly every organ of the body, causes many diseases, and reduces the health of smokers in general.1,2
Quitting smoking lowers your risk for smoking-related diseases and can add years to your life.
attributes.additional_details:
Nhs loses tax revenue from lost productivity when people are made ill by smoking. Conditions caused by smoking cost the NHS billions.
The cost of treating smokers in England was estimated at £2.7 billion in 2006. And that was 10 years ago just think how much it costs the NHS now

attributes.action: Give the people of the UK a veto (by referendum) of any trade deal
attributes.background:
The withdrawal of the UK from the EU will leave us in a position where unsafe trade deals could be made threatening the sovereignty of the UK over governance and standards of products and services.
The people of the UK need a deciding voice in any deal before it is enacted

attributes.action: Make All Public Parking including Hospitals 'FREE' for the Disabled
attributes.background:
It is a disgrace to make these pay, it it hit and miss with some charging and others not, should be the same throughout the country, I know some abuse the system with Blue Badges and should lose them for ever, the charges incurred it a lot of money for Disabled people.
We need a Three Hour system.
attributes.additional_details:
Hospitals make a lot of money already on poorly people, the Disabled should not be one, this is being Anti Disabled and must not be discriminated against.

Let's get things put in order with a system that the Disabled do not have to study each place on if they can or can not.

Disabled Agency sorts some things but money matters to these people on Low income.

attributes.action: Provide funding to migrate all NHS systems from Windows XP for security reasons
attributes.background: Barts NHS trust has just been hit with a ransomware attack, it was running Windows XP. 30 percent of all NHS trusts have been hit by ransomware according to an FOI request by Sentinel One. Moving off Windows XP is efficient, Imperial College NHS Trust found they cut help desk calls by 60 percent.
attributes.additional_details:
Upgrade from Windows XP would be a good start but proper endpoint security is needed to protect against ransomware. Dynamic endpoint protection and DNS level filtering. Anti malware and anti exploit protection is also necessary. 
http://www.computing.co.uk/ctg/news/3002565/barts-nhs-trust-windows-xp-pcs-infected-with-suspected-ransomware 
http://www.dclsearch.com/nhs-trusts-a-magnet-for-ransomware-foi-disclosures-reveal-it-security-news/ 
http://www.theregister.co.uk/2017/01/17/nhs_ransomware/

attributes.action: Change the law from late miscarriage to stillbirth.
attributes.background: I myself have had a stillbirth at 34 weeks just 9 month ago and I was outraged to discover that any children born before 24 weeks are categorised as a miscarriage. I want this changed.
attributes.additional_details: Many people don't realise that at this time the mother must give birth to their baby which is often fully formed. They hold them, love them and name them and yet they are non existent is the eyes of the law. They will not be offered a birth or death certificate or a funeral. This is heart breaking for the parents and family. I would like the law changed from miscarriage to still birth from the day any mother has to physically give birth to a baby.

attributes.action: Make PTSD a recognised illness for fair claim and recognition of PIP at DWP.
attributes.background: I would like the government to re-address the level of illness, disability and point scoring of PIP claims for PTSD. British people need fair claim for the illness that is debilitating and get the help in such times of need. There is apparent great need for this within the ex-services community.
attributes.additional_details: I tried claiming PIP on the encouragement of my social worker before medical discharg for PTSD. Following the interview for PIP, which was distresssing enough, I was given zero points, even though on the letter I received it stateded I obviously had some form of mental illness at this time. I could get nothing as it's not classed as a health condition or disability. I am well now but would have benefitted from the extra income, as I was unable to do many activitys of daily living due to my PTSD.

attributes.action: Award a campaign medal for members of Bomber Command in WW2.
attributes.background: 55,573 members of Bomber Command were killed in WW2 and have never received any official recognition for their sacrifice. It is time this injustice was corrected.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of hard wired electrical accessories to the general public.
attributes.background: Many house fires and potentially dangeous situations regarding the electeical installations in dwellings are caused by poor workmanship on electrical installations. The main reason for this is due to the availability of hard wired accessories to the general public, who then fit them themselves
attributes.additional_details: Many people will not touch the plumbing in thier house due to the possibility of a leak thus causing damage, but will happily tamper with the electrical installation of their own homes and sometimes others as they believe they know what they are doing but in reality, do not have the slightest clue and are totally incompetent to touch such systems. These people are putting peoples lives at risk everyday and are able to do so as anybody can purchase the equipment without proof of competence to fit

attributes.action: Ban pheasant shooting - a cruel, senseless 'sport'.
attributes.background: Living in the countryside, we sadly witness repeated pheasant shoots taking place right before our eyes. Despite what they say, the pheasants more often than not die in a slow, painful manner often landing in our garden whilst still alive, in agony, dying slowly.This so-called 'sport' needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Repeated pheasant shoots take place across the UK, but I am speaking from personal experience of it happening in North Lincolnshire, more often than not without any prior notice given.

The pheasants are bred, released into the surrounding area, then shot repeatedly by people who enjoy killing animals for fun.

The pheasants are often mauled while still alive by dogs and/or write in agony as they land on the ground.

This is inhumane and needs to be stopped as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Public enquiry:Investigate state of prisons. Bring British Army in to help staff
attributes.background: Prison staff are unable to cope with the safe running of our prisons. Staff and inmates safety must be priority. Promises of more staff have not been fulfilled. More training is needed for prison roles. Health and safety practice is poor. Begin a public enquiry. In the meantime; bring in our Army.
attributes.additional_details: Inmates rehabilitation is not to the standards that they could be. Inmates need guidance. The ratio of inmates per staff member is unreasonable. Thus, staff suffer and potentially risk their safety. Prison staff are over-worked and not paid enough in light of the work that they undertake. Inmates are often not in receipt of adequate care. The lack of rehabilitation of offenders affects all parts of our society. It is time to stop ignoring inmates and staff members needs.
